org.odk.collect.android.location.client

Class MaxAccuracyWithinTimeoutLocationClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.odk.collect.android.location.client.MaxAccuracyWithinTimeoutLocationClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener, LocationClient.LocationClientListener

    public class MaxAccuracyWithinTimeoutLocationClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements LocationClient.LocationClientListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener
    Provides location updates for a set timeout period. Once a request is initiated, updates are only provided if the new reading has higher accuracy. New requests reset the timeout and the highest accuracy.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MaxAccuracyWithinTimeoutLocationClient(LocationClient locationClient, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener listener) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onClientStart()
      Called after the LocationClient has been successfully started.
      void onClientStartFailure()
      Called if any issue ocurred during LocationClient start-up.
      void onClientStop()
      Called after the LocationClient has been stopped, either by calling LocationClient.stop() or because it was stopped by another process.
      void onLocationChanged(android.location.Location location)
      Updates the listener if location meets any of these criteria: - it is the first location update - it is more accurate than the most accurate one seen yet - it is the first location update with accuracy Otherwise, the new location reading is discarded.
      void requestLocationUpdates(long timeoutSeconds)
      Requests that location updates be provided to the listener for timeoutSeconds.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public void onLocationChanged(android.location.Location location)
